title: Design of an Informatics-Based National Security Analysis Program for Large-Scale Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and understanding of basic social science concepts
context.additional_context: A course fostering analytical capabilities for national security issues through informatics research, applying a mixed-methods approach (qualitative/quantitative analysis) in a project-based learning environment

learning_goals: Learners can systematically process security-related text data using information collection/analysis tools (e.g., data mining, NLP).
Learners can write case study reports on security using mixed research methodologies and derive academic conclusions.
Learners can visualize information science-based analysis results using tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and apply them to policy proposals.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
